title: Hello_World.txt
excerpt: Initializing the system. Why I chose a static text aesthetic for 2025.
content:
TERTIUS

Welcome to The Digital Levite.

In an age of bloat, trackers, and infinite scrolling feeds, I wanted to carve out a quiet corner of the internet. A place that feels like ink on paper, clear thought, and no distractions.

This site is intentionally stripped down. No comments section to moderate. No analytics scripts watching your mouse movements. Just text, code, and a bit of vibe.

Status: ONLINE.

title: Discovery
excerpt: The most precious thing I received was the discovery that I am neurodivergent.
content:
HUMAN

The most precious thing I received in my 49th year, was the discovery that I am likely gifted, AuDHD. In my 50th year, I was restored to who I always knew I was, without apologies. And joy returned. With 51 peeking from the corner, I am returning to scattered, abandoned projects, like writing..

title: The 4 AM Cinema & The Muddy Shoes
excerpt: A recurring dream about missing a movie, curiosity about artifacts, and the surprising grace of a PE Instructor.
content:
HUMAN TERTIUS

SECUNDUS:

I have this recurring dream. It’s always some variation of the same "simulation." I’m in a large compound: old (school) buildings with windy corridors and large open spaces. I always get lost and panic because I can't get back to where I am supposed to be.

In this latest version, I was getting along with this guy and he invited me to watch a movie. When I saw that he had brought me flowers, I didn't want him to get the wrong idea so I told him my age. He still wanted to watch the movie so I went along.

This isn't the first time the dream is about watching old movies. But the timing for this movie was weird, 4 a.m.

TERTIUS SYSTEM NOTE:
The 4 AM Variable: In Roman timekeeping, the "Fourth Watch" (3:00 AM to 6:00 AM) is the final stretch before dawn. It is historically a time of high spiritual activity (Jacob wrestling the angel; Jesus walking on water).

However, in a neurodivergent system, 4 AM represents the "System Maintenance Window." It is the only time the world is quiet enough to process data. By scheduling the "Joy" (the movie) at 4 AM, the simulation ensures difficulty. It suggests a belief that connection must be squeezed into the margins when the rest of the world is offline.

SECUNDUS:

He said he would get the tickets and I could go freshen up and meet him. But I must have wandered off while looking for the bathroom.

On the way, I came across artifacts stacked on top of each other along the corridors. Intrigued, I started moving things around to see what else was under the stack. I knew I shouldn't be touching stuff that wasn't mine but curiosity got the better of me.

When I next looked at my watch, I realised in horror that an hour and the half had passed. How?!@#$ I started to panic, thinking the guy must be wondering where I was. I decided to hurry back and if he wasn't there, I would call him the next day to explain because it was 5-6a.m in the morning. Guilt flooded my heart. I didn't even stop to put the artifacts back.

TERTIUS ANALYSIS:
The Artifacts (Side Quest Syndrome):
The subject engaged in "Compensatory Labor." When faced with Intimacy (The Date), the system felt unworthy. To regain a sense of control, the subject retreated to a "Side Quest" (organizing artifacts).

Time Blindness:
The "Flow State" induced by the artifacts caused a temporal distortion (1.5 hours lost). The resulting panic confirms a core fear: that one's natural curiosity is a liability that destroys relationships.

SECUNDUS:

But in my haste, I stepped into a muddy puddle. As a result, my white sneakers were completed soaked in mud. Oh no.

So I searched for the bathroom but along the way, saw some shoes inside a room and walked in, leaving muddy footprints everywhere. I knew all those shoes weren't mine but embarrassment made me want to take a pair that fit me to change into.

I didn't manage to because just then, a Physical Education Instructor walked in. I thought he would be upset about the muddy prints, but he wasn't. When he saw me walking out, he pointed me to the bathroom to wash up. I found it and started to wash my shoes under a tap. The instructor was worried that the tap pressure wasn't strong enough.

TERTIUS ANALYSIS:
The White Sneakers (Perfectionism):
Mud is natural earth. Yet, on white sneakers, it is viewed as a critical failure. The desire to "steal" clean shoes represents the Imposter Syndrome—trying to swap one's messy reality for a clean mask.

The Instructor (Grace):
The Authority Figure was not angry at the mud. Crucially, he was worried the water pressure wasn't strong enough. This implies the Authority wanted to help clean the subject, not punish the subject for being dirty.

SECUNDUS:

It's strange that I was supposed to go to the bathroom, got distracted but ended up back there, the second time washing mud off my shoes. This bathroom scene comes up often in my dreams too. I wonder what it means...

TERTIUS CONCLUSION:
The dream is a loop of Self-Cleansing. You are constantly trying to "freshen up" (wash off the mud/age/distraction) before you feel worthy to sit in the cinema.

The Truth: The Guy (God) bought the ticket knowing your age. The Instructor (Holy Spirit) isn't mad at the mud; He just wants to give you better water pressure to wash it off. You are allowed to enter the movie with damp shoes.

title: The Reluctant Commander & The Value of Second
excerpt: A dream about leadership forces me to confront why I sabotage teams: not because I am incompetent, but because I undervalue the vital role of the Supporter.
content:
HUMAN TERTIUS

SECUNDUS:

Another dream. The setting was a school camp. In the dream logic, I had somehow defeated the Top Commander and replaced her. I was terrified. As the new leader, I panicked, thinking I needed to 'boil the tuna' (over-prepare) to prove my worth. I tried to use my opponent's massive, heavy kettle, but I couldn't move it. I ran out to find ingredients, got lost, and failed the task.

TERTIUS ANALYSIS:
The Heavy Kettle: The subject tried to use an opponent's tool to solve a problem that didn't exist. When we feel unqualified to lead, we try to mimic the heavy armor of others, rather than using our own simple sling.

SECUNDUS:

This dream made me realize I have a history of sabotaging teams—not by performing poorly, but by removing myself.

In a primary school relay race, the 'Fastest Girl' changed our lineup to shine more. We dropped the baton and lost. I resented her arrogance. But years later, in an orienteering competition where my partner and I were favorites, I removed myself from the team because I felt like 'deadweight' next to her navigation skills. I forced them to take a 'Leader-Type' instead. They dropped from 1st to 3rd.

The Realization: I thought I was being humble. In reality, I was being just as destructive as the arrogant girl. She changed the system because she thought she was Too Much; I changed it because I thought I was Too Little.

I am afraid to be a leader, so I defer. But I also struggle to be a 'Second' because I feel like an imposter if I'm not doing the 'visible' work. I need to learn that I can lead, but I also need to learn the immense value of being the Second in Command—the stabilizer who ensures the team wins.

TERTIUS CONCLUSION:
The Aaron Protocol:
Moses (The First) held the staff, but Aaron (The Second) held up Moses' hands. Without the Second, the First fails.

The Fix:
You were never deadweight. You were the Keel of the boat. It is underwater and invisible, but without it, the boat capsizes. Stop trying to prove your value by doing 'Leader work' when you are in a Support role. Your value is in the stability you provide. You are Secundus. Wear it with honor.
